item.title: MP材料公司受益于美国政府价格支持，第四季度扭亏为盈
item.description: 稀土企业MP Materials周四宣布，受其与美国政府签订的价格支持协议及磁性材料销售推动，公司第四季度扭亏为盈，业绩超出分析师预期。【原文：Rare earths company MP Materials swung to a fourth-quarter profit, it said Thursday, exceeding analysts' expectations, driven by its price support agreement with the U.S. government and sale of magnetic material.】

item.title: 随着特朗普收紧对华科技限制，北京的出口管制日趋成熟
item.description: 中国扩大稀土出口管制近一年后，出口商仍在追问一个基本问题：当一枚小磁铁将日常用品变成管制物品时，究竟该如何界定？【原文：Almost a year after China expanded rare-earth export controls ostensibly aimed at preventing their use by foreign militaries, exporters are still asking a basic question: when does a small magnet turn an everyday product into a controlled item?】

item.title: Anthropic首席执行官称，该公司拒绝五角大楼在人工智能安全保障争议中的要求
item.description: 人工智能公司Anthropic首席执行官达里奥·阿莫代周四表示，该公司无法满足五角大楼在人工智能安全保障争议中的要求。【原文：Anthropic cannot accede to the Pentagon's requests in an AI safeguards dispute, the AI firm's CEO Dario Amodei said on Thursday.】

item.title: Netflix拒绝提高对华纳兄弟的收购报价
item.description: 网飞周四表示，在HBO Max母公司董事会认定派拉蒙天空舞影业的最新提案优于流媒体先驱现有的合并协议后，该公司将不再提高对华纳兄弟探索公司的收购报价。【原文：Netflix said on Thursday it will not raise its offer for Warner Bros Discovery after the HBO Max owner's board determined that Paramount Skydance's latest proposal was a "Superior Proposal" to the streaming pioneer's existing merger agreement.】

item.title: OpenAI概述加强安全措施的步骤，以应对加拿大校园枪击事件
item.description: OpenAI周四表示，将建立与加拿大执法部门的直接联络渠道，并加强重复违规者的检测力度。这些举措旨在提升其安全协议，此前加拿大发生了一起校园枪击事件。【原文：OpenAI said on Thursday that it will set up a direct point of contact with Canadian law enforcement and improve detection of repeat policy violators, among steps to boost its safety protocols in the wake of a recent school shooting in Canada.】

item.title: 怪兽饮料第四季度销售额和利润超出预期
item.description: 周四公布的财报显示，怪兽饮料公司第四季度销售额和利润均超出市场预期，这得益于在经济不确定性中其能量饮料需求的强劲表现。【原文：Monster Beverage beat fourth-quarter sales and profit estimates on Thursday, helped by resilient demand for its energy drinks amid economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 巴西货币委员会扩大航空公司获取公共航空基金的渠道
item.description: 巴西国家货币委员会（CMN）周四决定放宽由国家民航基金（FNAC）担保的航空公司贷款条件。该公共基金预计将从2026年起释放40亿雷亚尔（约合7.7866亿美元）资金。【原文：Brazil's National Monetary Council (CMN) decided on Thursday to loosen conditions on loans to airlines backed by the National Civil Aviation Fund (FNAC), a public fund expected to release 4 billion reais ($778.66 million) starting in 2026.】

item.title: 中国美格智能科技拟在香港上市筹集1.29亿美元
item.description: 据周五交易所公告显示，中国美格智能科技计划通过在香港上市筹集高达10.1亿港元（约合1.291亿美元）的资金。【原文：China's MeiG Smart Technology is looking to raise as much as HK$1.01 billion ($129.1 million) in its Hong Kong listing, according to an exchange filing on Friday.】

item.title: 墨西哥贝克莱公司第四季度利润下滑13%，因税负加重
item.description: 墨西哥贝克莱公司——全球最大的龙舌兰酒生产商——周四公布的财报显示，其第四季度净利润同比下滑12.8%，主要受销售额下降和税率上升影响。【原文：Mexico's Becle , the world's largest tequila maker, on Thursday posted a 12.8% drop in its fourth-quarter net profit compared to a year earlier, brought about by a dip in sales and higher tax rates.】

item.title: 博彩巨头Flutter预测2026年利润远低于预期，因美国市场面临挑战
item.description: FanDuel母公司Flutter预测2026年利润增长将较为温和，远低于分析师预期。这主要是由于这家博彩巨头在美国核心市场面临挑战，加之其通过促销和奖金吸引客户的尝试效果不佳。【原文：FanDuel-owner Flutter forecast modest profit growth for 2026 far below analyst expectations due to challenges in the betting giant's main U.S. market compounded by its misfiring attempts to win customers over with promotions and bonuses.】

item.title: 独家：ASML称新一代EUV光刻机已具备芯片量产能力，标志着人工智能芯片生产的关键转变
item.description: ASML控股公司的高管向路透社透露，其新一代芯片制造设备已准备就绪，制造商可开始将其投入大规模生产，这对芯片行业而言是重大进展。【原文：ASML Holding's next-generation chipmaking machine is ready for manufacturers to start bringing it into use for production at high volumes, a senior executive told Reuters, a big step for the chip industry.】

item.title: 交易日：英伟达失手错失良机
item.description: 科技股遭遇重挫，导致标普500指数和纳斯达克指数周四走低。此前投资者对人工智能芯片制造商英伟达财报的积极反应逐渐被疑虑和悲观情绪取代，而避险资产黄金和美国国债则出现上涨。【原文：A heavy selloff in tech stocks pushed the S&P 500 and Nasdaq lower on Thursday after investors' initial positive reaction to AI chipmaker Nvidia's results was replaced by doubt and pessimism, while safe-haven assets gold and Treasuries rose.】

item.title: 维珍澳大利亚半年利润超预期，假日需求强劲
item.description: 维珍澳大利亚航空周五公布的半年期基本利润增长20.7%，超出市场预期。强劲的客户需求及其转型计划带来的效益共同推动了公司盈利增长。【原文：Virgin Australia posted a 20.7% rise in half-year underlying profit on Friday, beating estimates as strong customer demand and benefits from its transformation program lifted the bottom line.】

item.title: 布林克斯以66亿美元收购NCR Atleos
item.description: 布林克斯公司周四宣布，将以现金加股票的方式收购NCR Atleos，交易总价值约66亿美元（含债务）。受此消息影响，这家数字零售解决方案供应商的股价在盘后交易中下跌11.1%，报收120.50美元。【原文：Brinks Co on Thursday said it will acquire NCR Atleos in a cash-and-stock deal valued at about $6.6 billion including debt, sending the digital retail solutions provider's shares down 11.1% in after-hours trading to $120.50.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟称派拉蒙报价更优，奈飞回应进入倒计时
item.description: 华纳兄弟探索公司表示，派拉蒙修订后的每股31美元报价优于其与奈飞的现有协议，给这家流媒体巨头四天时间作出回应，否则将退出这场争夺好莱坞梦工厂的竞购战。【原文：Warner Bros Discovery said Paramount's revised $31-a-share offer was superior to its existing deal with Netflix, giving the streaming giant four business days to respond or walk away from the bidding war for the coveted Hollywood studio.】

item.title: 杰克·多尔西旗下Block公司因人工智能应用扩大将裁员逾4000人，股价应声大涨
item.description: Block公司周四宣布将裁减逾4000个岗位，约占其员工总数的一半。随着人工智能技术的进步重塑其业务构建与运营模式，该公司股价在盘后交易中飙升22%。【原文：Block on Thursday said it will cut over 4,000 jobs, or nearly half its workforce, as advances in AI reshape how it builds and runs its business, sending its shares up 22% in after-hours trading.】

item.title: Coupang第四季度营收达88亿美元，未达分析师预期
item.description: 电商巨头Coupang公司周四公布的数据显示，其第四季度营收同比增长11%，低于分析师预期。【原文：E-commerce giant Coupang Inc on Thursday posted an 11% rise in fourth-quarter revenue from a year earlier, missing analysts' estimates.】

item.title: CoreWeave第四季度营收超出预期
item.description: CoreWeave周四公布的季度营收超出华尔街预期，得益于人工智能热潮推动企业涌向其平台，以获取训练和部署先进AI模型所需的强大计算能力。【原文：CoreWeave beat Wall Street estimates for quarterly revenue on Thursday, benefiting from the artificial intelligence boom that has driven companies to its platform for the massive computing power needed to train and deploy advanced AI models.】

item.title: 戴尔预测2027财年营收将超预期，因人工智能服务器需求持续攀升
item.description: 戴尔周四预测2027财年营收将超出华尔街预期，押注其人工智能优化服务器的需求增长，推动其股价在盘后交易中上涨约6%。【原文：Dell forecast fiscal 2027 revenue above Wall Street estimates on Thursday, betting on growing demand for its artificial intelligence-optimized servers, sending its shares up around 6% in extended trading.】

item.title: LGBTQ+交友应用Grindr营收超预期，押注人工智能驱动增长
item.description: Grindr周四公布的财报显示，其第四季度营收超出预期，并扩大了4亿美元的股票回购计划。这家面向LGBTQ+群体的交友应用正押注人工智能驱动的功能来推动增长。【原文：Grindr on Thursday reported fourth-quarter revenue above estimates and expanded its share repurchase program by $400 million, as the LGBTQ+ dating app bets on artificial intelligence-powered features to drive growth.】

item.title: 英特尔预计因美国纳税季营销支出增加，利润将低于预期
item.description: 英特尔周四预测第三季度利润低于华尔街预期，因其预计将在美国纳税季期间增加营销支出以吸引更多客户。【原文：Intuit forecast third-quarter profit below Wall Street estimates on Thursday, as it anticipates higher marketing spending to attract more customers during the U.S. tax season.】

item.title: Duolingo优先考虑用户增长而非盈利，预计预订量将放缓
item.description: Duolingo周四预测，其第一季度及2026年预订量将低于预期。这家语言学习应用正调整战略以加速用户增长，该公司表示此举将拖累今年的预订量增长和盈利能力。【原文：Duolingo forecast first-quarter and 2026 bookings below expectations on Thursday as the language-learning app shifts strategy toward faster user growth, a move it said will weigh on bookings growth and profitability this year.】

item.title: 《金融时报》报道，拉斯维加斯赌场集团凯撒娱乐正考虑收购意向
item.description: 《金融时报》周四报道称，凯撒娱乐公司正在评估来自多家潜在竞购方的收购要约，其中包括得克萨斯州博彩及酒店业亿万富翁蒂尔曼·费尔蒂塔的报价。【原文：Caesars Entertainment is weighing takeover offers from several potential bidders, including a bid from Texas gaming and hospitality billionaire Tilman Fertitta, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 墨西哥总统谢恩鲍姆宣布可口可乐将在墨西哥投资60亿美元
item.description: 墨西哥总统克劳迪娅·谢恩鲍姆在社交媒体发文称，可口可乐全球首席执行官恩里克·布劳恩周四在会晤中告知她，该公司将在墨西哥投资60亿美元。【原文：Coca-Cola's global CEO Henrique Braun informed Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum of a $6 billion investment in Mexico during a meeting on Thursday, Sheinbaum said in a post on social media.】

item.title: 沃什领导的美联储提前降息概率随乐观预期下滑
item.description: 美联储主席提名人凯文·沃什的降息之路可能正逐渐收窄。尽管特朗普总统期待美联储上任即降息，但美国经济前景日益乐观、企业高管信心持续增强，加上投资者注意到央行决策者立场趋于鹰派，这些因素正共同挤压沃什的政策空间。【原文：Federal Reserve chair nominee Kevin Warsh's path to out-of-the-gate interest rate cuts in alignment with President Donald Trump's expectations could be narrowing amid emerging bullishness about the U.S. economy, growing CEO confidence in the outlook, and investors keying off a hawkish shift among the central bank's policymakers.】

item.title: 美联储官员古尔斯比预测今年还将多次降息，但不会很快实施。
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯坦·古尔斯比周四表示，他预测今年晚些时候将多次降息，这使他成为美联储政策制定者中较为"乐观"的一员。但他同时表示，希望美联储在此过程中保持"谨慎"，因为降息可能导致经济过热和通胀加剧。【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve President Austan Goolsbee said on Thursday his forecast for several interest-rate cuts later this year makes him one of the more "optimistic" Fed policymakers, but said he wants the Fed to be "careful" in doing so because it could overheat the economy and inflation.】

item.title: 英伟达预计游戏芯片短缺将持续至年底
item.description: 英伟达高管表示，全球游戏芯片短缺可能持续到今年年底，这预示着视频游戏行业将面临更多困境——该行业因消费者需求放缓导致销售疲软而已不堪重负。【原文：A global shortage of gaming chips could last until the end of this year, an Nvidia executive has said, signaling more pain for the video game industry that is already buckling under weak sales due to slowing consumer demand.】

item.title: 美国监管机构或将向议员披露世界自由银行的申请材料
item.description: 美国国家银行监管机构负责人周四表示，将考虑一项请求，允许国会高级成员审查由特朗普家族支持的加密货币企业World Liberty Financial的银行执照申请。【原文：The head of the national U.S. bank regulator said on Thursday he would consider a request to allow senior members of Congress to review the bank charter application of World Liberty Financial, a crypto venture backed by the family of President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 庞巴迪首席执行官称公司有望在印度提升公务机销量
item.description: 印度改善机场基础设施的举措将为庞巴迪公司提供提升该国公务机销量的机会，该公司首席执行官埃里克·马特尔周四向记者表示。【原文：India's efforts to improve its airport infrastructure will give Bombardier a chance to boost sales of business jets there, chief executive officer Eric Martel told reporters on Thursday.】

item.title: IDC称，受内存价格飙升影响，2026年智能手机市场将面临有史以来最大跌幅
item.description: 国际数据公司周四表示，随着内存芯片价格飙升推高设备成本，全球智能手机市场将在2026年遭遇有史以来最严重的下滑，出货量将跌至十余年来的最低水平。【原文：The global smartphone market is poised to suffer its biggest decline ever in 2026, sinking to a more than decade low in shipments, as surging memory chip prices drive up device costs, the International Data Corporation said on Thursday.】
